title: Computer Vision Teaching Assistant
description: As a teaching assistant for Brown's Computer Vision (CSCI 1430) course, I worked directly with the Professor James Tompkin to craft and lecture interactive socially responsible computing discussion sections where students learn to responsibly architect machine learning & computer vision models, formulate stakeholder defense arguments, and  in a stakeholder  Built, taught, and graded course materials for 150+ students (more than 50% graduates or seniors).

title: Mathematics Research Assistant
description: I assisted mathematics education research with Professors Heather Hill and Jeanette Coppersmith by integrating natural language processing platforms to improve manual coding workflows of mathematical education data and research.

title: IgniteCS Program Organizer
description: As a program organizer for Google's IgniteCS chapter in Providence, I led, taught, and organized computer science learning events for elementary schools in Rhode Island. Through this program, I mentored students in low income communities with concepts like algorithms, robotics, artificial intelligence, and computer literacy at an early age.

title: Data Analyst
description: I worked with a team of data scientists to craft research-based, integrated Computer Science and Data Science modules using Pyret for Math, Science, Business, and Social Studies classes in grades 5-12. I worked on collecting, analyzing, and data visualizing Colleges in the US data, assessing for various bias factors and trends across demographics.

title: Research Assistant and Educator
description: I researched synaptic plasticity, divisions of the central nervous system, and the effects of sleep on declarative and nondeclarative memory with a team of scientists at Sunovion. I also helped develop and teach a course on the brain and memory to high school students at the Advanced Math and Science Academy in Marlborough.
